bibl.title: Columbia George v. Charles B. Hopkins. Verification of Attorney
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

div1.p: State of Washington County of King

I, R J Slater, being first duly sworn, say: that I am attorney for Columbia George in the above entitled matter; that I am personally acquainted with him, and know him to be a full blood Indian, and of my own personal knowledge I know all the facts stated in the above Petition to be true, and I make this verification for him for the reason that I know the facts of my own personal knowlede and that he is not present in King County, and he does not understand the English language and cannot understand the contents of this Petition without the aid of an interpreter and there is no one at McNeil's Island who is qualified to interpret the same to him.
In Witness Whereof I have hereunto set my hand this 24th day of February, 1906.
Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 24th day of February, 1906
Notary Public in and for said County and State, residing at Seattle, said County
